findings.rationale: Project rules mandate root-level install.sh, uninstall.sh, and post_install_validator.py. README.md references these files. Currently only ransomeye_operations (Rust) and ransomeye_installer (Python) exist as module-level implementations.

Standalone module (Phase 21) MUST have installer, uninstaller, and service definition per project rules. README states 'stand-alone' but provides no operational components. Rules explicitly state: 'FAIL immediately if any module claims stand-alone but lacks installers.'

Standalone module (Phase 22) MUST have installer, uninstaller, and Windows service definition per project rules. README states 'stand-alone' but provides no operational components. Rules explicitly state: 'FAIL immediately if any module claims stand-alone but lacks installers.' Windows Agent requires MSI installer per specification.

Standalone module (Phase 23) MUST have installer, uninstaller, and service definition per project rules. README states 'stand-alone' but provides no operational components. Rules explicitly state: 'FAIL immediately if any module claims stand-alone but lacks installers.'

Project rules mandate ALL systemd service files must reside in /home/ransomeye/rebuild/systemd/. Currently, service files exist in /home/ransomeye/rebuild/ransomeye_operations/systemd/ (7 services) but only ransomeye-github-sync.service exists in root systemd/ directory. This violates the unified systemd policy.
